document_title: Atrial fibrillation: Causes, signs and diagnosis you need to know
subsection_content:
According to Dr. Huy, many patients have no symptoms or very vague symptoms. Atrial fibrillation is only discovered by chance through a routine medical examination. (3)
Some other patients may have symptoms of atrial fibrillation, such as:
Nervousness, palpitations in the chest.; Shortness of breath, irregular heartbeat or rhythm; Difficulty breathing, especially when moving or exercising; Lightheadedness, dizziness or even the feeling of fainting.; Reduced ability to exercise, weakness, easy fatigue; Chest heaviness, chest tightness, chest pain.
In addition, atrial fibrillation is also one of the causes of stroke. Many patients only learn they have atrial fibrillation after being hospitalized for a stroke.
